newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT - India wallows ahead of SBI issue.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT - India wallows ahead of SBI issue.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) wallowed in thin trade ahead of a new issue from State Bank of India, which is expected to be priced on October 3.
"Trade is limited ahead of State Bank of India -- market talk is of the issue being priced at parity to the underlying stock," said a trader.
State Bank of India's underlying share closed up 0.60 rupees at 263.05, equating to around $7.30 per GDR, with each GDR equivalent to two underlying shares.

The James Capel Indian GDR Index fell 0.12, or 0.17 percent to 68.66 points, a premium of 12.65 percent over the local market after the Bombay Stock Exchange 30 share index rose 6.64 points, 0.20 percent, to 3,337.73.
Trading in Taiwanese equities was also thin, with the Capel Taiwan Index falling 0.06 points, or 0.07 percent, to 88.15 points for a premium of 2.71 percent over the local market.
The Taiwan Weighted Index had gained 23.87 points or 0.37 percent to end at 6,477.85.
The Capel Korea Index rose 1.01 points 1.53 percent to 66.86 points, a premium of 28.26 percent over the local market after te Korea Composite Index rose 8.71 points to provisionally close at 777.91.

Samsung GDRs followed the local market higher, adding $1.63 to $43.00/$45.00, after the underlying rose 1,300 won, or 2.21 percent, to 60,200 won, while KEPCO rose 56 cents to $19.00/$20.00 after the local stock put on 700 won, or 2.59 percent, to 27,700 won.
